column4: ... idk reighnakj. to be honest im reallly new to the linux thing myself. i just remembered i had a problem with ubuntu 11.04 installing from cd ...
have you booted from cd before on your computer reighnakj? i know when i did that it took a while cuz i had a crappy system
reighnakj so when you put the cd in and boot from it, it just goes to the loading dots and thats all ?
reighnakj what does it do when you just let it boot from disc normally ??
yeah try booting from hd and see what happens :S im not sure what its doing from the cd
reighnakj thats what i did. i like it that way i have options of switching back and forth.
amy_ what do you mean disabled?
amy_ do you mean you made them disappear?
amy_ i did that too before ... cant remember what i did ... give me a sec and ill see if i can remember
press CTRL+ALT+T when I get the term open? or was there a paste that i didn't catch?

I also have been doing a bit of investigative poking, and with r-click on desktop,  applications -> settings -> XFCE manager, there's an icon for panel, but clicking it brings up no panel, nor a configuration menu/display.
I did try the paste though,it appeared to do nothing.
figured it out. I just had to run xfce4-panel, though your suggestion of gnome panel put me on the right track!
though, I do have to ask. How do I have that run permanently in the background. When I close the term, it kills the command
